# swagger-java-client

Simple Car Service
- API version: 3.1.0
  - Build date: 2024-05-30T07:42:11.226905188Z[GMT]

No description provided (generated by Swagger Codegen https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-codegen)


*Automatically generated by the [Swagger Codegen](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-codegen)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:
1. Java 1.7+
2. Maven/Gradle

## Installation

To install the API client library to your local Maven repository, simply execute:

```shell
mvn clean install
```

To deploy it to a remote Maven repository instead, configure the settings of the repository and execute:

```shell
mvn clean deploy
```

Refer to the [OSSRH Guide](http://central.sonatype.org/pages/ossrh-guide.html) for more information.

### Maven users

Add this dependency to your project's POM:

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>io.swagger</groupId>
  <artifactId>swagger-java-client</artifactId>
  <version>1.0.0</version>
  <scope>compile</scope>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle users

Add this dependency to your project's build file:

```groovy
compile "io.swagger:swagger-java-client:1.0.0"
```

### Others

At first generate the JAR by executing:

```shell
mvn clean package
```

Then manually install the following JARs:

* `target/swagger-java-client-1.0.0.jar`
* `target/lib/*.jar`

## Getting Started

Please follow the [installation](#installation) instruction and execute the following Java code:

```java
import io.swagger.client.*;
import io.swagger.client.auth.*;
import io.swagger.client.model.*;
import io.swagger.client.api.CarApi;

import java.io.File;
import java.util.*;

public class CarApiExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        
        CarApi apiInstance = new CarApi();
        CarCreateRequest body = new CarCreateRequest(); // CarCreateRequest | 
        try {
            apiInstance.addCar(body);
        } catch (ApiException e) {
            System.err.println("Exception when calling CarApi#addCar");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}

import io.swagger.client.*;
import io.swagger.client.auth.*;
import io.swagger.client.model.*;
import io.swagger.client.api.CarApi;

import java.io.File;
import java.util.*;

public class CarApiExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        
        CarApi apiInstance = new CarApi();
        CarUpdateRequest body = new CarUpdateRequest(); // CarUpdateRequest | 
        String name = "name_example"; // String | 
        try {
            apiInstance.updateCar(body, name);
        } catch (ApiException e) {
            System.err.println("Exception when calling CarApi#updateCar");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
```

## Documentation for API Endpoints

All URIs are relative to */*

Class | Method | HTTP request | Description
------------ | ------------- | ------------- | -------------
*CarApi* | [**addCar**](docs/CarApi.md#addCar) | **POST** /car | Add a new car to the store
*CarApi* | [**deleteCar**](docs/CarApi.md#deleteCar) | **DELETE** /car/{name} | Deletes a car
*CarApi* | [**getAllCarsBasicInfo**](docs/CarApi.md#getAllCarsBasicInfo) | **GET** /carsBasic | Find all cars basic information
*CarApi* | [**getAllCarsFullInfo**](docs/CarApi.md#getAllCarsFullInfo) | **GET** /carsFull | Find all cars full information
*CarApi* | [**updateCar**](docs/CarApi.md#updateCar) | **PUT** /car/{name} | Update an existing car

## Recommendation

It's recommended to create an instance of `ApiClient` per thread in a multithreaded environment to avoid any potential issues.
